node.title: Her Persistence Paid Off
node.description: Giovanni Rivera and Barbara Delgado were on the verge of breaking up when she wanted to make their relationship exclusive. But she refused to call it quits.
node.content: ["Four years ago, Barbara Delgado received a text message from Giovanni Rivera asking who she was.", "\u201cI was partying like a crazy person and had so many numbers I didn\u2019t know who she was,\u201d said Mr. Rivera, 40, who at the time was separated from his first wife and enjoying the bachelor life. \u201cI met a lot of people because I didn\u2019t want to be alone.\u201d", "\u201cI didn\u2019t remember meeting him either,\u201d Ms. Delgado, 33, added. ", "In the days after, the two talked on the phone several times before agreeing to meet the following week. \u201cI told her my philosophy of life and discovered she was a great listener,\u201d Mr. Rivera said.", "Months before they began talking, Mr. Rivera in February 2017 was suspended without pay from his position as a Port Authority of New York and New Jersey police officer, leaving him with more time on his hands. (He is appealing the decision.)", "Mr. Rivera, who is Italian and Puerto Rican, grew up in the Bronx and received an associate degree in labor studies from SUNY Empire State College. He has an 8-year-old daughter, Bella; he and his ex-wife share custody.", "Ms. Delgado, who was born in Mexico City and raised in Seattle, graduated from the University of Washington with a degree in business administration. She is the owner of the Hair After NYC, a hair and makeup business based in New York.", "On July 5, 2017, the day of their first date for drinks at Carroll Place, an Italian restaurant and bar in Greenwich Village, Mr. Rivera arrived an hour early. Ms. Delgado, coming from work, arrived an hour late, just as he was preparing to leave.", "\u201cBarbara was apologetic about being late,\u201d Mr. Rivera said. \u201cI thought she was stunning, unpretentious and real. She asked about Bella and didn\u2019t talk about herself. We gabbed until 3 a.m.\u201d", "Ms. Delgado said she liked his outgoing personality and smart humor. \u201cHe was family oriented and a great conversationalist.\u201d", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "After their second date, at a comedy club, they spent a weekend in Atlantic City dining on Italian food and laughing. But when Ms. Delgado wanted to make the relationship exclusive, Mr. Rivera wanted to break up.", "She was not willing to call it quits, however. \u201cI quickly called him back because I thought he was honest, from a similar culture, and had a big heart,\u201d Ms. Delgado said. \u201cHe encouraged my career, and I trusted him. I wanted to give it a chance.\u201d", "Her persistence paid off. In 2018, they moved into an Upper East Side apartment together, where the couple was forced to confront Mr. Rivera\u2019s anxiety about not working and his frustrations about needing to borrow from his savings.", "\u201cMy anxiety was high and I drank to feel normal, but after two years of Barbara\u2019s love and waking up happy each morning, I tapered off,\u201d he said. \u201cShe has supported me every single day.\u201d", "Ms. Delgado added, \u201cEven though we had some rough patches with his anger over the job situation, I am an optimistic person, and he treats me with love, like a best friend. Things are better now.\u201d", "In December 2020, the couple moved to Edgewater, N.J. They spent a great deal of time with Bella, taking her to area malls, street fairs, trampoline parks and on trips to Lake George. \u201cBarbara has helped me gain the love of my daughter who barely saw me during my marriage because I worked such long hours,\u201d Mr. Rivera said.", "On Feb. 15, while Ms. Delgado was unpacking groceries in the kitchen, he proposed with a topaz ring. \u201cI cried while saying yes,\u201d she said.", "They were married Oct. 19, on Miami Beach behind the Shelborne South Beach hotel, because Ms. Delgado had dreamed of an oceanfront ceremony in Florida. To honor their different cultures, the service was translated in English, Spanish and Italian by the officiant, Frank Nunez, who is ordained as both a Catholic and Universal Life minister. Face masks and hand sanitizer were provided to their 39 guests.", "A 1950s Cuban themed outdoor reception featured cigar rollers and, as d\u00e9cor, a rented 1959 Ford Thunderbird painted pink.", "\u201cGivoanni\u2019s struggles have been difficult, but have made our resolve unbreakable,\u201d Ms. Delgado said. \u201cThroughout all of that hardship our love grew stronger. We can face whatever challenges come our way.\u201d"]
